summary: This bill, the Ohkay Owingeh Rio Chama Water Rights Settlement Act of 2025, aims to resolve water rights claims of the Ohkay Owingeh Pueblo in the Rio Chama Stream System in New Mexico. It approves a settlement agreement, authorizes funding, and details the terms of water rights management, including allocations, leasing, and the establishment of a trust fund for implementing the agreement. The bill also addresses environmental compliance, releases claims, and specifies conditions for the enforceability and potential expiration of the act. Key aspects include bosque restoration, environmental compliance, and federal oversight.
